cellularAutomata.reflection
Class ReflectionTool

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.reflection.ReflectionTool

public class ReflectionTool
extends java.lang.Object

Reflection methods used by the CA code.

Author:
David Bahr

ReflectionTool

public ReflectionTool()
Method Detail

getLatticeDescriptionFromClassName

public static java.lang.String getLatticeDescriptionFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to get the description of a Lattice from its class name.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
A description of the Lattice class corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Lattice or if the Lattice does not have a default constructor.

getLatticeFromClassName

public static Lattice getLatticeFromClassName(java.lang.String className,
                                              java.lang.String initialStateFilePath,
                                              Rule rule)
Uses reflection to get the lattice from its class name.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
A lattice corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Lattice or if the Lattice does not have a constructor that take the correct parameters.

getLatticeToolTipFromClassName

public static java.lang.String getLatticeToolTipFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to get the tooltip for a Lattice from its class name.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
A tooltip for the Lattice class corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Lattice or if the Lattice does not have a default constructor.

getMinimalLatticeFromClassName

public static Lattice getMinimalLatticeFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to get the lattice from its class name, but does not create the actual arrayList that holds the lattice structure. Simply instantiates the class so that its methods are accessible. Useful for calling methods such as getDisplayName() and getNumberOfNeighbors().

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
A lattice corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Lattice or if the Lattice does not have a default constructor.

getNumberOfNeighborsFromLatticeClassName

public static int getNumberOfNeighborsFromLatticeClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to get the number of neighbors for a cell on the lattice specified by its class name (in other words, something like "TriangularLattice.class").

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
The number of neighbors of a cell. Returns -1 if this value changes with location on the lattice.

getNumberOfNeighborsFromLatticeDescription

public static int getNumberOfNeighborsFromLatticeDescription(java.lang.String latticeDescription)
Uses reflection to get the number of neighbors for a cell on the lattice specified by its display name (in other words, something like "Square (8 neighbor)"). Hint: the display name is easy to get from the properties.

Parameters:
latticeDescription - The display name of the lattice which should be something like "Square (8 neighbor)".
Returns:
The number of neighbors of a cell. Returns -1 if this value changes with location on the lattice.

instantiateMinimalAnalysisFromClassName

public static Analysis instantiateMinimalAnalysisFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to create an Analysis from its class name with a minimal memory footprint. This method should be used when we only want to query the analysis for its name, tooltip, etc and are not planning to run the analysis.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
The Analysis class corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Analysis or if the Analysis does not have a constructor that takes a Properties object as a parameter.

instantiateFullAnalysisFromClassName

public static Analysis instantiateFullAnalysisFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to create an Analysis from its class name. Use this method when the analysis will actually be run and isn't being queried just for it's display name or tooltip (etc).

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
The Analysis class corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Analysis or if the Analysis does not have a constructor that takes a Properties object as a parameter.

instantiateFullRuleFromClassName

public static Rule instantiateFullRuleFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to create a Rule from its class name. Use this method when the rule will actually be run and isn't being queried just for it's display name or tooltip (etc).

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
The Rule class corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Rule or if the Rule does not have a constructor that takes a Properties object as a parameter.

instantiateMinimalRuleFromClassName

public static Rule instantiateMinimalRuleFromClassName(java.lang.String className)
Uses reflection to create a Rule from its class name with a minimal memory footprint. This method should be used when we only want to query the rule for its name, tooltip, etc and are not planning to run the rule.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class (including package). Must end in ".class".
Returns:
The Rule class corresponding to the className parameter. Null if the name does not correspond to an appropriate Rule or if the Rule does not have a constructor that takes a Properties object as a parameter.
